tit.cmt: 以下天皇名、人名の読み方は、ブリタニカ国際大百科事典、広辞苑、kotobank.jpで確認。

sen.j: 村上天皇（むらかみてんのう、延長4年6月2日（926年7月14日） - 康保4年5月25日（967年7月5日）、在位：天慶9年4月28日（946年5月31日） - 康保4年5月25日（967年7月5日））は、平安時代中期の天皇。
sen.e: Emperor MURAKAMI (July 1st, 926 - 5th July, 967), his reign was 31st May, 946 - 5th July 967, he was the Emperor in middle Heoan Period.
Emperor Murakami (July 1, 926 - 5th July, 967) reigned in the mid-Heian period (from May 31, 946 to July 5, 967).

sen.j: 天慶7年（944年）4月22日に皇太子となり、同9年4月13日に朱雀天皇の譲位により践祚、同月28日に即位。
sen.e: He became Crown Prince on April 22nd, 944 and enthroned on 28th in the same month after Emperor SUZAKU abdicated.
He became the crown prince on April 22, 944 and was enthroned on the 28th of the same month after the abdication of Emperor Suzaku.
He became the crown prince on April 22, 944 and was enthroned on the 28th of the same month after the abdication of Emperor Suzaku (April 13, 946).

sen.j: 先代に続いて天皇の外舅藤原忠平が関白を務めたが、天暦3年（949年）に忠平が亡くなるとそれ以降摂関を置かず、延喜時代とともに天皇親政の典範とされた。
sen.e: Emperor's father in law, FUJIWARA no Tadahira continued to work as a chancellor (chief cabinet advisor to the emperor) from the previous Emperor's era, after Tadahira died in 949 there was no one appointed as a regent and a chancellor and the Emperor ruled the government directly, which became Imperial House Law followed by Engi Period.

The Emperor's father-in-law, FUJIWARA no Tadahira, continued to work as a chancellor (chief cabinet advisor to the Emperor) from the previous Emperor's era, since after Tadahira died in 949 there was no one appointed as a regent so a chancellor and the Emperor ruled the government directly; this became Imperial House Law, followed by the Engi period.

The Emperor's father-in-law, FUJIWARA no Tadahira, continued to work as a chancellor (chief cabinet advisor to the Emperor) from the previous Emperor's era, since after Tadahira died in 949 there was no one appointed as a regent so a chancellor and the Emperor ruled the government directly; this became Imperial House Law, followed by the Engi period.

sen.j: しかし実際には政治の実権は依然摂関家の藤原実頼・藤原師輔兄弟にあり、更に母の穏子や兄の朱雀法皇も後見を名目に政治に関与しようとしたため、親政は表象にすぎなかった。
sen.e: However actual control of the politics was still with FUJIWARA no Saneyori and FUJIWARA no Morosuke brothers of regent and chancellor family, not only that Emperor's mother Onshi and older brother, the retired Emperor Suzaku in pious life tried to get involved in politics in nominal terms, the government which was supposed to be ruled by the Emperor was a superficial government.

However, the actual control of politics was still with FUJIWARA no Saneyori and FUJIWARA no Morosuke (brothers of the regent-and-chancellor family); however, not only did the Emperor's mother Onshi and older brother, the retired Emperor Suzaku in his pious life, try to get involved in politics in nominal terms, but the government--which was supposed to be ruled by the Emperor--was a superficial one.

However, the actual control of politics was still with FUJIWARA no Saneyori and FUJIWARA no Morosuke (brothers of the regent-and-chancellor family); in addition, the Emperor's mother Onshi and older brother, the Cloistered Emperor Suzaku in his pious life, tried to get involved in politics as guardians, so the government--which was supposed to be ruled by the Emperor--was a superficial one.
sen.cmt: however→in addition の訳修正as a guardian の訳を補足but→so"retired Emperor Suzaku"→"Cloistered Emperor Suzaku"に変更しました。

sen.j: 平将門・藤原純友の起こした承平・天慶の乱（935年 - 940年）の後、朝廷の財政が逼迫していたので倹約に努め物価を安定させた。
sen.e: After the Shohei and Tengyo Rebellion caused by TAIRA no Masakado, FUJIWARA no Sumitomo (935 - 940), as the Imperial financial situation was tight, the Emperor encouraged saving money and helped to stabilize in prices.
sen.cmt: 承平・天慶の乱 定訳不明
sen.e: Subsequent to the Shohei and Tengyo Rebellion caused by TAIRA no Masakado, FUJIWARA no Sumitomo (935 - 940), because the imperial financial situation was tight, the Emperor encouraged the saving of money and helped to stabilize prices.

sen.j: 文治面では、天暦5年（951年）に『後撰和歌集』の編纂を下命したり、天徳4年（960年）3月に天徳内裏歌合を催行したりするなど、歌人としても歌壇の庇護者としても後世に評価される。
sen.e: In civil administration area, the Emperor ordered to edit "Go-sen Waka Shu, Later Collection of Japanese Poetry" in 951, or organized Tentoku Dairi Utaawase (a tanka matching, a tanka (writing) contest) in March 960, he was highly regarded as a poet and a protector of the the world of tanka poetry, tanka circles after ages.

In the area of civil administration, the Emperor ordered the editing of "Go-sen Waka Shu (Later Collection of Japanese Poetry)" in 951, or organized Tentoku Dairi Utaawase (a tanka match, or a tanka (writing) contest) in March 960, being highly regarded as a poet and protector of the world of tanka poetry; this reptution continued in subsequent ages.

sen.j: 琴・琵琶などの楽器にも精通し、平安文化を開花させた天皇といえよう。
sen.e: He was well informed about koto(a zither-like Japanese instrument) and biwa (a Japanese lute), he is well known Emperor who let the Heian Period culture flowering.
He was well informed about the koto (a zither-like Japanese instrument) and biwa (a Japanese lute), and today he is well known as the Emperor who encouraged the flowering of the Heian period.

sen.j: 天皇の治績は「天暦の治」として後世景仰された。
sen.e: The Emperor's administration was highly regarded as 'the peaceful era of Tenryaku' after ages.
The Emperor's administration was highly regarded as 'the peaceful era of Tenryaku,' in contrast to the preceding ages.

sen.j: しかしその反面、この時代に外戚政治の土台が一段と固められ、吏治にも公正さが失われる一方、天徳4年の内裏焼亡をはじめとする数々の災難があった。
sen.e: On the other hand the base of the politics controlled by Emperor's maternal family was established further during this reign and there was no fairness in the politics, there were some disasters such as the Imperial Palace burned down in Tentoku 4 and so on.

On the other hand, the political basis controlled by the Emperor's maternal family became more established during this reign and there was no fairness in politics; moreover, there were disasters such as when the Imperial Palace burned down in Tentoku 4, and so on.

sen.j: 康保4年（967年）5月25日、在位のまま42歳で崩御。
sen.e: On May 25th, 967, the Emperor died when he was forty two years old while he was still in power.
